segment.source: When you create a new IAP (in-app product) in the Windows Dev Center dashboard, you'll need to specify a product type and assign it a product ID.
segment.target: When you create a new IAP (in-app product) in the Windows Dev Center dashboard, you'll need to specify a product type and assign it a product ID.

segment.source: Set your IAP product type and product ID
segment.target: Set your IAP product type and product ID

segment.source: Set your IAP product type and product ID
segment.target: Set your IAP product type and product ID

segment.source: An IAP must be associated with an app that you've created in the dashboard already (even if you haven't submitted it yet).
segment.target: An IAP must be associated with an app that you've created in the dashboard already (even if you haven't submitted it yet).

segment.source: You can find the button to Create a new IAP on either your app's Overview page or its IAPs page.
segment.target: You can find the button to Create a new IAP on either your app's Overview page or its IAPs page.

segment.source: Once you've clicked the button, you'll see the Create a new IAP page.
segment.target: Once you've clicked the button, you'll see the Create a new IAP page.

segment.source: Here, you'll need to specify a product type and assign it a product ID.
segment.target: Here, you'll need to specify a product type and assign it a product ID.

segment.source: Product type
segment.target: Product type

segment.source: First, you'll need to indicate which type of IAP you are offering.
segment.target: First, you'll need to indicate which type of IAP you are offering.

segment.source: This selection refers to how the customer can use your IAP.
segment.target: This selection refers to how the customer can use your IAP.

segment.source: Note You won't be able to change the product type after you save this page to create the IAP.
segment.target: Note You won't be able to change the product type after you save this page to create the IAP.

segment.source: If you did choose the wrong product type, you can always delete your in-progress IAP submission and start over by creating a new IAP.
segment.target: If you did choose the wrong product type, you can always delete your in-progress IAP submission and start over by creating a new IAP.

segment.source: Select the product type that is appropriate for your IAP:
segment.target: Select the product type that is appropriate for your IAP:

segment.source: Consumable: A product that can be purchased, used (consumed), and then purchased again.
segment.target: Consumable: A product that can be purchased, used (consumed), and then purchased again.

segment.source: Consumable IAPs are often used for things like in-game currency (gold, coins, etc.) which can be purchased in set amounts and then used up by the customer.
segment.target: Consumable IAPs are often used for things like in-game currency (gold, coins, etc.) which can be purchased in set amounts and then used up by the customer.

segment.source: Durable: A product that’s bought and owned by the buyer for a specified period of time.
segment.target: Durable: A product that’s bought and owned by the buyer for a specified period of time.

segment.source: Durable IAPs are often used to unlock additional functionality in an app.
segment.target: Durable IAPs are often used to unlock additional functionality in an app.

segment.source: Durable IAPs are not consumed, but you can set the Product lifetime so that they expire after a set duration (with options from 1-365 days).
segment.target: Durable IAPs are not consumed, but you can set the Product lifetime so that they expire after a set duration (with options from 1-365 days).

segment.source: The default Product lifetime for a durable IAP is Forever, which means the IAP never expires.
segment.target: The default Product lifetime for a durable IAP is Forever, which means the IAP never expires.

segment.source: You can change this to a different duration in the IAP properties step of the IAP submission process.
segment.target: You can change this to a different duration in the IAP properties step of the IAP submission process.

segment.source: Product ID
segment.target: Product ID

segment.source: Enter a unique product ID for your IAP.
segment.target: Enter a unique product ID for your IAP.

segment.source: This is the same identifier that you will need to reference in your app's code to call the IAP.
segment.target: This is the same identifier that you will need to reference in your app's code to call the IAP.

segment.source: Here are a few things to keep in mind when choosing a product ID:
segment.target: Here are a few things to keep in mind when choosing a product ID:

segment.source: Customers won't see this product ID.
segment.target: Customers won't see this product ID.

segment.source: (Later, you can enter a title and description to be displayed to customers.)
segment.target: (Later, you can enter a title and description to be displayed to customers.)

segment.source: You can’t change or delete an IAP's product ID after it's been published.
segment.target: You can’t change or delete an IAP's product ID after it's been published.

segment.source: A product ID can't be more than 100 characters in length.
segment.target: A product ID can't be more than 100 characters in length.

segment.source: A product ID cannot include any of the following characters: % & : ? + ,
segment.target: A product ID cannot include any of the following characters: % & : ? + ,

segment.source: To offer your IAP on all devices, you must only use alphanumeric characters, periods, and/or underscores.
segment.target: To offer your IAP on all devices, you must only use alphanumeric characters, periods, and/or underscores.

segment.source: If you use any other types of characters, the IAP will not be available for purchase to customers running Windows Phone 8.1 or earlier.
segment.target: If you use any other types of characters, the IAP will not be available for purchase to customers running Windows Phone 8.1 or earlier.

segment.source: A product ID doesn't have to be unique within the Windows Store, but it must be unique to your developer account.
segment.target: A product ID doesn't have to be unique within the Windows Store, but it must be unique to your developer account.
